definition: to compensate/to make good (a financial loss)
to press against/to support/to prop up/to resist/to equal/to balance/to make up for/to mortgage/to arrive at/to clap (one's hands) lightly (expressing delight) (Taiwan pr. [zhi3] for this sense)
to repay/to compensate for/to recompense/to fulfill (hopes etc)

sentences.english: Their goods were distrained upon for rent.
sentences.chinese: 他們的財產被扣押以抵償租金。

sentences.english: We often borrow from our tomorrows to pay our debts to our yesterdays.
sentences.chinese: 我們常常拿明天的錢來抵償昨天的帳。

sentences.english: 9，We wonder whether you do counter trade.
sentences.chinese: 我們不知道你們是否做抵償貿易。

sentences.english: However, if they fail, all of their accumulated wealth can be destroyed.
sentences.chinese: 即使失敗了，自身累計財富也可以用來抵償。

sentences.english: We wonder whether you do  counter trade.
sentences.chinese: 我們想知道你們是否做抵償貿易。

sentences.english: Death still leaves a margin of inexpiable guilt.
sentences.chinese: 形容罪大惡極，即使處死刑也抵償不了他的罪惡。

sentences.english: The boss couldn't pay me ten thousand dollars he owed me but let me take it out in his car.
sentences.chinese: 老闆沒付欠我的一萬元，而是以他的汽車作爲抵償。

definition: to take revenge and wipe out a grudge (idiom)
not recognizing one's family (idiom); self-centered and not making any allowances for the needs of one's relatives
a new branch grows out of a knot (idiom); fig. side issues keep arising
to deal with/to wait on/to provide for
to judge between right and wrong/to reason things out
to take the blame for sb else/to compensate for one's crime/to get charges dropped (by paying money etc)
to spend the whole day eating (i.e. not doing any work)
sharp ears and keen eyes (idiom)/keen and alert/perceptive
full of youthful vigor (idiom)/in the prime of youth
